programme.title: Leopard Kingdom
programme.desc: Karula, the Queen of Djuma, reigned over South Africas Sabi Sand for over a decade. But now, the queen is gone. Her offspring now hope to claim the land that was once hers. .

programme.title: Africa's Big Five
programme.desc: Africa's most iconic animals were coined THE BIG FIVE by trophy hunters. See these amazing creatures battle the elements and each other to survive.

programme.title: World's Deadliest: Sharks
programme.desc: They lurk in the depths‚Ä¶burst into the air with extreme force‚Ä¶tanks of hungry muscle. They stalk their prey with mega-mouths‚Ä¶. and lethal jaws. They're on patrol at every depth - equipped with superpowers and amazing senses. World's Deadliest Sharks highlights several species of sharks including the tiger shark, the nurse shark, and the grand daddy of all, the great white.

programme.title: Killer Snakes
programme.desc: Packed with a potent neurotoxic venom, one family of snakes kill more people than any other on earth. Scientists around the world race to uncover how.

programme.title: America's Wild Spaces
programme.desc: National Geographic Television joins a rare scientific odyssey to explore the Canyon's entire 277-mile length and examine its mysteries.

programme.title: America's Wild Spaces
programme.desc: Papahanaumokuakea Marine National Monument, encompasses the Northwestern Hawaiian Islands. A month long scientific expedition will journey to these remote waters to map the uncharted.

programme.title: Snakes In The City
programme.desc: Snake catcher Simon Keys and herpetologist, Siouxsie Gillett's business poses life and death situations. Every capture has its dangers, from an almost fatal mamba attack to the risks of being buried under a collapsing house with a snake.

programme.title: Snake City: Baby Snakes
programme.desc: A snake City Compilation with the best of all the baby snakes.

programme.title: Killer Snakes
programme.desc: Packed with a potent neurotoxic venom, one family of snakes kill more people than any other on earth. Scientists around the world race to uncover how.

programme.title: Snakes In The City
programme.desc: Snake catcher Simon Keys and herpetologist, Siouxsie Gillett's business poses life and death situations. Every capture has its dangers, from an almost fatal mamba attack to the risks of being buried under a collapsing house with a snake.

programme.title: Snake City: Baby Snakes
programme.desc: A snake City Compilation with the best of all the baby snakes.

programme.title: Legends Of Venom: Compilation
programme.desc: Venture to untamed corners of the world, where snakes reign with their unique blend of elegance and danger. The King Cobra, the world‚Äôs longest venomous snake. The black mamba, a lightning-fast predator that strikes with astonishing accuracy. And the rattlesnake, the icon of America‚Äôs west known for its telltale warning. Discover the extraordinary lives of these venomous legends.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Guinea pigs, tortoises, mares, and cows! From the largest to the smallest, it‚Äôs a never-ending parade of patients at PVS! Doc treats a duck in distress while time is of the essence when a mare experiences choke. Charles and Abigail stop by with a pet of their own. Dr. Nicole examines an Eskie who had a run-in with a 4-wheeler and Lisa makes heroic efforts to save a cow and her calf.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: When similar cases create double trouble, Doc Pol and Dr. Lisa are an unstoppable dynamic duo. Together, they help a horse with a mysterious neck lump, and they're up to their paws in a marathon puppy check. Dr. Lisa treats another horse while Dr. Pol assists some ill-feeling fowl friends. Plus, two vets are better than one when back-to-back cases of injured dogs arrive at PVS.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: A major storm blows into Central Michigan, and as the snow piles up, so do the cases! While clients brave the weather to get care for their animals, Dr. Pol and Charles battle thundersnow when responding to an emergency farm call. Dr. Lisa needs ten stitches to repair a horses deep cut, and Dr. Brenda treats a Rottweilers very swollen face. .

programme.title: Built For The Kill
programme.desc: The crocodile is the world's largest reptilian predator, but it takes years of intensive training to learn to be lethal. It enters the world as a replica of its adult form, only four thousand times smaller. Built for the Kill: Crocodile follows the transformation of a tiny hatchling into an accomplished killer, exposing real life-and-death struggles in dramatic second-by-second detail.

programme.title: Built For The Kill
programme.desc: The hyena, much maligned and misunderstood, is no slobbering scavenger. It's a calculating killer: as smart as a primate, as lethal as a lion. Built for the Kill: Hyena follows the transformation of a tiny cub into an accomplished hunter; exposing real life and death struggles in dramatic second-by-second detail. .

programme.title: Built For The Kill
programme.desc: The big bad wolf is 100 pounds of muscle and teeth, but it's born blind, deaf and weighs just one pound. Built for the Kill: Wolf follows the transformation of a helpless pup into an accomplished killer, exposing real life-and-death struggles in dramatic second-by-second detail. The wolf hones its hunting skills over about two years of intensive training-and the lessons are hard.

programme.title: Built For The Kill
programme.desc: The polar bear is the world's largest land predator-but it's born blind and deaf. How does a helpless cub become a successful killer? Built for the Kill: Polar Bear exposes real life and death struggles in dramatic second-by-second detail. The cub spends about three years at its mother's side, learning to navigate the harsh Arctic environment. .

programme.title: Built For The Kill
programme.desc: The killer whale is the world's biggest dolphin-32 feet long and up to six tons heavy. Smart, sophisticated, and social, they live in groups and hunt cooperatively. But it's no natural born killer. Calves spend several years at their mother's side, learning how to hunt some of the smallest-and biggest-animals in the sea. Built for the Kill: Killer Whale exposes real life and death struggles in dramatic second-by-second detail.

programme.title: Predator V Prey
programme.desc: A forensic look at how polar bears hunt prey, offering new perspectives on the tactics they use to track, stalk and ambush seals, whales and walruses. Following a mother fighting to feed her two cubs in the harsh polar extremes, and a young male driven by starvation to tackle enormous prey.

programme.title: Africa's Deadliest: Compilation
programme.desc: Across Africa, a deadly game of hide and seek unfolds. Crocodiles lie in wait for unknowing impala. A royal python‚Äôs heat-detection makes it a frightening predator prey can‚Äôt evade. Hyenas forgo their scavenging ways to target young leopards, prompting maternal defenses as the young take cover in the trees. Choosing to fight, hide or flee can mean the difference between life and death.

programme.title: Blood Rivals: Lion vs. Buffalo
programme.desc: In Africa, no other herbivore rivals the buffalo with its brute force and collective strategy; honed over millennia in an evolutionary blood feud with the ultimate predator. For most of the year the breeding herd fends off relentless attacks from the resident lion pride. Then, when the dry season sucks water away from the grasslands, they migrate beyond the reach of the killers, but risk starvation.
